New Records: The eight pitchers used by the Dodgers was a World Series record for a clinching win.
The Dodgers became the first team to come back from five or more runs down in a World Series-clinching win.
Walker Buehler became only the second pitcher in World Series history to earn a win as a starter and record the save in the clinching victory.
Freddie Freeman tied the Fall Classic record of 12 RBIs set by Bobby Richardson over seven games in 1960.
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge and Jazz Chisholm Jr hit back-to-back homers in the first inning.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a solo shot to right in the third inning.
The Dodgers piled on five unearned runs in the fifth inning.
The Yankees nosed ahead 6-5 on a Stanton sacrifice fly in the sixth inning.
The Dodgers took the lead for good in the eighth on a pair of sacrifice flies by Gavin Lux and Mookie Betts.
Blake Treinen struck out Anthony Rizzo to end the threat in the eighth inning.
Walker Buehler struck out Alex Verdugo for the final out.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone said, 'As I said to the guys, obviously it stings now. But this is going to sting forever.'
Walker Buehler commented, 'There’s just a lot of ways we can win baseball games. Obviously the superstars we have on our team and the discipline, it just kind of all adds up.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers and Yankees were meeting in the World Series for a 12th time, making it the most frequent matchup in the history of the Fall Classic.
The Yankees were back in the Fall Classic for the first time since 2009.
